Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. MHD_pool_is_resizable_inplace (connection->pool, connection->read_buffer, connection->read_buffer_size)) { mhd_assert (0); return false; } /* we can actually grow the buffer, do it! */ rb = MHD_pool_reallocate (connection->pool, connection->read_buffer, connection->read_buffer_size, new_size); if (NULL == rb) { /* This should NOT be possible: we just computed 'new_size' so that it should fit. If it happens, somehow our read buffer is not in the right position in the pool, say because someone called MHD_pool_allocate() without 'from_end' set to 'true'? Anyway, should be investigated!
